lines.text:
[gasps]
You locked him away? Your own son? Because he is... unholy? Oh, this I cannot understand. How can you be so cruel?
[dazed and exhausted, holding her head in her hands]

[calmly]
You are judging me, child. Sleep before you pass sentence.

[gasping in disbelief]
Then that poor prisoner, in the tower. He is your son?
He was my son. Now he is only... a beast of the night.

[resurrected as a vampire]
Marianne... my darling Marianne... you haven't forgotten your little Gina? Put you arms around me, please, I want to kiss you, Marianne. Please be kind to me. Say that you forgive me for letting *him* love me.
Why can't she lie in peace, like all the rest?
Because she is not *like* all the rest!
Who is it that is not afraid?
Then you know who I am?

Transylvania, land of dark forests, dread mountains and black, unfathomed lakes. Still the home of magic and devilry as the nineteenth century draws to it's close. Count Dracula, monarch of all vampires, is dead, but his disciples live on, to spread the cult and corrupt the world.
